basics.name: Muge Zhang
basics.label: PhD Applicant
basics.summary: MS in Applied Computer Science with extensive research in microarchitectural performance analysis, AI-powered cache mechanisms, and optimization techniques for IoT and machine learning workloads.

researchExperience.name: Energy Improvement Opportunities in Extended Reality (XR) Platforms
researchExperience.summary: Conducted micro-architectural analysis of pre-processing stages in ML workloads, identifying bottlenecks in data-heavy applications across vision, audio, text, and multimodal domains.

researchExperience.name: Enhancing VLLM Performance through Cache Optimization
researchExperience.summary: Optimized VLLM's cache mechanism using an LFRU algorithm, improving performance over the benchmark.

researchExperience.name: Improving Hierarchical Clustering in Large-Scale Data Systems
researchExperience.summary: Developed optimization methods for hierarchical clustering within the MapReduce framework, achieving a significant reduction in running time while maintaining high accuracy.

publications.name: A High Performance AI-powered Cache Mechanism for IoT Devices
publications.publisher: International Conference on Cyber-enabled Distributed Computing and Knowledge Discovery (CyberC), IEEE
publications.summary: AI-powered caching mechanism improving IoT devices' performance and privacy.

publications.name: Hierarchical Agglomerative Clustering Optimization for Massive Data
publications.publisher: International Conference on Scalable Computing and Communications (ScalCom), IEEE
publications.summary: Optimization method for large-scale data systems, achieving significant reductions in processing time.

publications.name: Microarchitectural Analysis of Pre-processing Stage in Machine Learning Workloads
publications.publisher: 7th International Conference on Algorithms, Computing and Artificial Intelligence, IEEE
publications.summary: Microarchitectural analysis of ML workloads to optimize performance.
